With this effort we see a number of new releases!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* [near-jsonrpc-client-rs 0.8.0 release](https://github.com/near/near-jsonrpc-client-rs/releases/tag/v0.8.0) that uses [the latest near-primitives v0.20](https://crates.io/crates/near-primitives) and other crates released from [nearcore](https://github.com/near/nearcore) itself!\\\\\\\\n* [near-sdk-rs 5.0.0-alpha.2 release](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/releases/tag/near-sdk-v5.0.0-alpha.2)\\\\\\\\n* [near-abi-rs](https://github.com/near/near-abi-rs) 0.4.2 release\\\\\\\\n* [near CLI (Rust)](https://near.cli.rs) 0.7.7 release\\\\\\\\n* [bos CLI](https://bos.cli.rs) 0.3.11 release\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nMore releases coming to:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* [near-workspaces-rs](https://github.com/near/near-workspaces-rs)\\\\\\\\n* [cargo-near CLI](https://github.com/near/cargo-near)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nAll these releases together are heading towards fully-integrated developer experience on NEAR!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n```\\\\\\\\ncargo near new\\\\\\\\ncargo test\\\\\\\\ncargo near build\\\\\\\\ncargo near deploy\\\\\\\\n```\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nCreate a new contract, test it in a local sandbox, build an optimized and reproducible binary with built-in [ABI](https://github.com/near/abi), and deploy it!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nHow awesome is that?\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}, "handle": "fellowship"}

{"handle": "fellowship", "community": {"tag": "fellowship", "name": "NEAR Platform Fellowship", "addons": [{"id": "d1wywg", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"About\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"DevDAO\\\\\\'s paid program offers financial rewards to experienced NEAR developers and newcomers for their contributions to NEAR Platform (blockchain, devtools, documentation). By collaborating on the developer productivity tools for NEAR\\\\u{2019}s Blockchain Operating System [BOS], Zero Knowledge [ZK], and Smart Contracts, community members can foster innovation and enrich our developer community.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Why is it needed?\\\\\\\\nAs the NEAR ecosystem grows rapidly, there is an increasing need to improve developer productivity. While open-source communities are essential to manage these needs, new developers may find it challenging to get started. The DevDAO NEAR Platform Fellowship Program aims to solve this issue by providing guidance to new contributors from experienced developers.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### What are the focus areas?\\\\\\\\nDevDAO focuses on improving work in the following strategic areas within the NEAR ecosystem:\\\\\\\\n- Blockchain Operating System implementation\\\\\\\\n- Zero Knowledge SDK\\\\\\\\n- JavaScript on-chain and off-chain SDK\\\\\\\\n- Rust on-chain and off-chain SDK\\\\\\\\n- Mobile development (native iOS/Android, and cross-platform frameworks like Flutter)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWithin each area, there are a number of tasks to complete, including developing security and contract development toolkits, creating productivity tools, and maintaining open-source repositories. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nDevDAO wants to prioritize contributions to the following repositories: \\\\\\\\n- [docs](https://github.com/near/docs)\\\\\\\\n- [near-api-js](https://github.com/near/near-api-js)\\\\\\\\n- [near-jsonrpc-client-rs](https://github.com/near/near-jsonrpc-client-rs)\\\\\\\\n- [near-cli-rs](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs)\\\\\\\\n- [near-cli](https://github.com/near/near-cli)\\\\\\\\n- [near-sdk-rs](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs)\\\\\\\\n- [near-sdk-js](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-js)\\\\\\\\n- [workspaces-rs](https://github.com/near/workspaces-rs)\\\\\\\\n- [workspaces-js](https://github.com/near/workspaces-js)\\\\\\\\n- [wallet-selector](https://github.com/near/wallet-selector)\\\\\\\\n- [create-near-app](https://github.com/near/create-near-app)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### How does it work?\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nDevDAO\\\\\\'s NEAR Platform Fellowship Program is a way for active and experienced NEAR developers to empower new contributors and solve the focus areas above. Here\\\\u{2019}s it works: \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n1. **Apply**: Experienced contributors apply to become a Fellowship Leader by submitting a proposal on DevHub. The proposal must include a timeline, budget to allocate to new contributors, and a focus area.\\\\\\\\n2. **Approve**: DevDAO and the NEAR community review the proposal to ensure that it aligns with the NEAR community goals and that the budget is reasonable.\\\\\\\\n3. **Invite**: Upon acceptance, the Fellowship Leader invites new contributors to participate in the project. The Fellowship Leader is responsible for evaluating and negotiating compensation (see [funding guidelines](https://www.neardevgov.org/blog/near-developer-governance-funding-guidelines)) with the new contributors. \\\\\\\\n4. **Execute**: Once the team is assembled, they can begin working on the project. \\\\\\\\n5. **Compensate**: Once the work is complete, contributors submit their contribution report on DevHub. The Fellowship Leader must provide an attestation to confirm the work and compensation amount. DevDAO will then work to issue the payment.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nTo help bootstrap the program, DevDAO invites experienced developers to apply from various expert entities such as Pagoda, Aurora, Proximity, Human Guild, and Calimero. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### How to submit a fellowship proposal?\\\\\\\\nSubmit a fellowship proposal on the [NEAR DevHub](http://neardevhub.org) using these guidelines:\\\\\\\\n- Create a new \\\\u{201c}Solution\\\\u{201d} post.\\\\\\\\n- Add the \\\\u{201c}fellowship\\\\u{201d} and \\\\u{201c}fellowship-proposal\\\\u{201d} labels to your post.\\\\\\\\n- Provide a clear description of the project goals, scope, deliverables, and timeline.\\\\\\\\n- Describe the skills and experience you are looking for from new contributors.\\\\\\\\n- Set a budget for your fellowship using the [funding guidelines](https://www.neardevgov.org/blog/near-developer-governance-funding-guidelines). Note that the compensation will get paid directly from DevDAO to contributors.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nOnce you have submitted your proposal, the DevDAO team will review it and provide feedback. If your proposal is approved, you can start recruiting fellow contributors.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### How to be a great fellowship leader?\\\\\\\\nAs a Fellowship Leader, your role is crucial in empowering successful contributions to our ecosystem. To be an effective leader, it is essential to perform several key tasks:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Define the scope of work**: Submit a well-defined proposal with clear goals.\\\\\\\\n- **Find contributors**: Utilize networking, various community groups, and applications left on DevHub as comments to your proposal to find contributors.\\\\\\\\n- **Onboard contributors**: Set clear expectations, including your availability and communication guidelines. Additionally, provide well-defined tasks with the relevant context and acceptance criteria.\\\\\\\\n- **Oversee execution**: Deliver quality results that meet the needs of our ecosystem by monitoring the project, providing feedback to contributors, and promptly responding to questions.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### How to be a great contributor?\\\\\\\\nNew contributors play an essential role in our ecosystem, bringing fresh perspectives and ideas. If you\\\\u{2019}re looking to make meaningful contributions and gain guidance from experienced developers, here are some tips to help you get started:  \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Apply to a fellowship**: Find [available fellowship proposals on NEAR DevHub](/#/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.Feed?label=fellowship-proposal) and leave a comment with your application for a project that interests you.\\\\\\\\n- **Align with your Fellowship Leader**: If you are selected, it is important to align with your Fellowship Leader on the expectations and requirements for the project.\\\\\\\\n- **Be self-sufficient**: While your Fellowship Leader is there to guide you, it is important to become self-sufficient quickly and focus on completing your work. This means taking initiative to learn and communicating when you need support.\\\\\\\\n- **Provide updates**: Post a contribution report on DevHub to provide transparency and potentially to get compensated.\\\\\\\\n- **Keep improving**: As you gain more knowledge and experience, we hope that you continue to contribute to our ecosystem and share your insights to enable others to contribute too.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### How to submit a contribution report?\\\\\\\\nTo ensure transparency and accountability, DevDAO requires all contributors to submit a contribution report on the [NEAR DevHub](http://neardevhub.org) once the work is complete using these guidelines:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- Create a new \\\\u{201c}Solution\\\\u{201d} post.\\\\\\\\n- Add the \\\\u{201c}fellowship\\\\u{201d} and \\\\u{201c}contribution-report\\\\u{201d} labels to your post.\\\\\\\\n- Add the requested compensation amount\\\\\\\\n- In the description, reference the relevant fellowship proposal post. And list your contributions with references (e.g. PRs, issues, etc), the time spent, and [the factors to consider when determining the compensation amount](https://www.neardevgov.org/blog/near-developer-governance-funding-guidelines).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nOnce you have submitted your contribution report, your Fellowship Leader must reply to it with an attestation confirming that the report is accurate and that they are offering a certain amount of their pre-approved budget.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nDevDAO will keep track of the attestations and take appropriate action to approve the payment unless there are any concerns raised.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### What does DevDAO expect in the short term?\\\\\\\\nOver the next three months, DevDAO aims to board 10 fellowship leaders who will help us establish and scale this program. We welcome feedback from the community, so please share your thoughts by replying to this post.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nTo learn more about the DevDAO goals, check out [the recently posted OKRs](/#/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.Post?id=531). Together, we can build a community where developers share ideas, collaborate on projects, and learn from each other.\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "About"}], "admins": ["frol.near", "bo.near", "gagdiez.near"], "handle": "fellowship", "logo_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreibysr2mkwhb4j36h2t7mqwhynqdy4vzjfygfkfg65kuspd2bawauu", "banner_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreic4xgorjt6ha5z4s5e3hscjqrowe5ahd7hlfc5p4hb6kdfp6prgy4", "description": "Fellowship Program to grow contributions to NEAR Platform", "website_url": null, "bio_markdown": "DevDAO\\\\\\'s paid program offers financial rewards to experienced NEAR developers and newcomers for their contributions to the NEAR Platform (blockchain and devtools). [Learn more](https://bit.ly/4507tna)", "github_handle": null, "twitter_handle": null, "telegram_handle": null}}

{"data": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"January 2024 Coding Challenge\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Backstory**\\\\\\\\nIn the NEAR Protocol universe, a flourishing digital economy has led to an explosion of digital assets, including various cryptocurrencies and tokens. Amidst this growth, a shadow looms over the ecosystem: the proliferation of scam coins. These are tokens that are often airdropped into user wallets without consent, often bearing enticing names like \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Instant Winner\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" or \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Claim Your Prize at scam.com.\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" Their purpose is to mislead or defraud users.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Problem**\\\\\\\\nMany users are finding their wallets cluttered with these scam coins. These tokens not only cause confusion but also pose a security risk, as interacting with them can lead to phishing attacks or other scams. Moreover, these tokens utilize storage space in the users\\\\\\' wallets, which in the NEAR Protocol, is a limited resource that users essentially rent. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Opportunity**\\\\\\\\nA feature of the NEAR Protocol is that for a token to appear in a user\\\\\\'s wallet, the user\\\\\\'s account must be registered with the token\\\\\\'s smart contract. This registration process reserves storage space for the token in the user\\\\\\'s wallet. (Hint) This also means that users have the ability to unregister from these tokens, reclaiming their storage space and potentially even receiving a refund for the storage rental. **note: there are security considerations that you don\\\\\\'t need to manage for this, the goal is to learn some of NEAR\\\\\\'s tech**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Outline for the Coding Challenge**\\\\\\\\n*Overview*\\\\\\\\nDevelop a utility for NEAR Protocol wallet users that identifies scam coins in their wallet, enables them to unregister from these coins\\\\\\' contracts, and reclaim their storage space.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Key Features**\\\\\\\\n*Scam Coin Identification:*\\\\\\\\nThe utility will maintain a list of known scam coins, identified by their contract names.\\\\\\\\nUsers can view this list within the utility.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n*Wallet Scanning:*\\\\\\\\nThe utility scans the user\\\\\\'s wallet to identify any scam coins present.\\\\\\\\nIt cross-references the wallet\\\\\\'s tokens against the list of known scam coins.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n*Unregister and Reclaim Storage:*\\\\\\\\nFor identified scam coins, the utility provides an option to call on their contracts.\\\\\\\\nThis operation unregisters the user from the scam coin\\\\\\'s contract and reclaims the storage space.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Nice to have**\\\\\\\\n*Community-Driven Blacklist:*\\\\\\\\nUsers can submit new scam coins to be added to the blacklist.\\\\\\\\nA voting system allows the community to validate these submissions, reducing the risk of false positives.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n*User Interface:*\\\\\\\\nA simple and intuitive interface for listing scam coins, scanning the wallet, and performing the unregister operation on BOS.\\\\\\\\nClear instructions and warnings about the implications of unregistering from a token\\\\\\'s contract.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Rules:**\\\\\\\\nThe code should be tested and deployed on the NEAR testnet or mainnet.\\\\\\\\nDue 11:59 UTC Jan 31st\\\\\\\\nSubmissions sent into https://form.jotform.com/240095676821158\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nNeed a little help or have questions? Check out our office hours on Thursdays 11am & 6pm UTC or through chat in discord https://discord.gg/Ee4axDASaW or telegram https://t.me/neardev\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}, "handle": "devhub-marketing"}

{"data": {"devhub-marketing.community.devhub.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"January 2024 Coding Challenge\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Backstory**\\\\\\\\nIn the NEAR Protocol universe, a flourishing digital economy has led to an explosion of digital assets, including various cryptocurrencies and tokens. Amidst this growth, a shadow looms over the ecosystem: the proliferation of scam coins. These are tokens that are often airdropped into user wallets without consent, often bearing enticing names like \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Instant Winner\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" or \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Claim Your Prize at scam.com.\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" Their purpose is to mislead or defraud users.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Problem**\\\\\\\\nMany users are finding their wallets cluttered with these scam coins. These tokens not only cause confusion but also pose a security risk, as interacting with them can lead to phishing attacks or other scams. Moreover, these tokens utilize storage space in the users\\\\\\' wallets, which in the NEAR Protocol, is a limited resource that users essentially rent. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Opportunity**\\\\\\\\nA feature of the NEAR Protocol is that for a token to appear in a user\\\\\\'s wallet, the user\\\\\\'s account must be registered with the token\\\\\\'s smart contract. This registration process reserves storage space for the token in the user\\\\\\'s wallet. (Hint) This also means that users have the ability to unregister from these tokens, reclaiming their storage space and potentially even receiving a refund for the storage rental. **note: there are security considerations that you don\\\\\\'t need to manage for this, the goal is to learn some of NEAR\\\\\\'s tech**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Outline for the Coding Challenge**\\\\\\\\n*Overview*\\\\\\\\nDevelop a utility for NEAR Protocol wallet users that identifies scam coins in their wallet, enables them to unregister from these coins\\\\\\' contracts, and reclaim their storage space.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Key Features**\\\\\\\\n*Scam Coin Identification:*\\\\\\\\nThe utility will maintain a list of known scam coins, identified by their contract names.\\\\\\\\nUsers can view this list within the utility.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n*Wallet Scanning:*\\\\\\\\nThe utility scans the user\\\\\\'s wallet to identify any scam coins present.\\\\\\\\nIt cross-references the wallet\\\\\\'s tokens against the list of known scam coins.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n*Unregister and Reclaim Storage:*\\\\\\\\nFor identified scam coins, the utility provides an option to call on their contracts.\\\\\\\\nThis operation unregisters the user from the scam coin\\\\\\'s contract and reclaims the storage space.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Nice to have**\\\\\\\\n*Community-Driven Blacklist:*\\\\\\\\nUsers can submit new scam coins to be added to the blacklist.\\\\\\\\nA voting system allows the community to validate these submissions, reducing the risk of false positives.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n*User Interface:*\\\\\\\\nA simple and intuitive interface for listing scam coins, scanning the wallet, and performing the unregister operation on BOS.\\\\\\\\nClear instructions and warnings about the implications of unregistering from a token\\\\\\'s contract.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Rules:**\\\\\\\\nThe code should be tested and deployed on the NEAR testnet or mainnet.\\\\\\\\nDue 11:59 UTC Jan 31st\\\\\\\\nSubmissions sent into https://form.jotform.com/240095676821158\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nNeed a little help or have questions? Check out our office hours on Thursdays 11am & 6pm UTC or through chat in discord https://discord.gg/Ee4axDASaW or telegram https://t.me/neardev\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

"{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Overview\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"About the Contract Standards Community\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Contracts are the fundamental components of dApps. NEAR Protocol\\\\u{2019}s contracts enable the possibilities of dApp development, and their standards ensure consistency in core primitives for those applications. If you are a dApp developer, you\\\\u{2019}re invested in contract standards! This group exists to connect those with interests in these standards to discuss and improve current standards, and maybe even propose new standards if such a need should arise.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## TIMELINE OF KEY EVENTS/HIGHLIGHTS \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n2023 Key Highlights \\\\\\\\n(Last updated June 14)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### COMMUNITY\\\\\\\\n- 167 members\\\\\\\\n- 2 community calls\\\\\\\\n- 4 Working Group calls\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### NEPS\\\\\\\\n- NEP-276 Payout NFT Standard Extension\\\\\\\\n- NEP-351 Add standards key to ContractSourceMetadata\\\\\\\\n- NEP-423 Add contract_metadata_update event\\\\\\\\n- NEP-463 Add nft_metadata_update event to NEP-171\\\\\\\\n- NEP-393 Adding soulbound token\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### EVENTS\\\\\\\\n- No events yet!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n---------\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## STRUCTURE\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nAs with many core DevHub groups, the Contract Standards group has two main parts:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Working Group\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis formal group is a selected committee of subject matter experts who make official decisions on proposals and questions related to the NEAR dApp standards. They follow a strict process to review proposals, recommend funding to DAO or grant programs, and hold grant takers accountable. They engage with the broader community to understand their needs and encourage ideation.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Members**\\\\\\\\n- [Alexander Fadeev](https://github.com/fadeevab)\\\\\\\\n- [Evgeny Kapun](https://github.com/abacabadabacaba)\\\\\\\\n- [Robert Zaremba](https://github.com/robert-zaremba)\\\\\\\\n- [Vlad Frolov](https://github.com/frol)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Community Group\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis informal self-organized group provides a space for anyone interested in changes to the NEAR dApp standards. While this group does not make official decisions, it offers a great opportunity to meet with others to share ideas and submit proposals. This group is not controlled by anyone but the people who are organizing it. The group has a dedicated Telegram channel.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Communication Channels**\\\\\\\\n- [Contract Standards Community Group in Telegram](https://t.me/nearnft)\\\\\\\\n- Here on the discussions page!\\\\\\\\n- Check the Events tab for upcoming Community/Work Group calls.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Current Work & Topics of Discussion  \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nIf you\\\\u{2019}d like to add a current topic you\\\\u{2019}re working on as part of this community, please make a post on the main Group page for inclusion!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Community Links  \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n##### Community Organizations / Projects\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n##### Reference Material\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nIf you\\\\u{2019}d like to add links to your project, interesting reference material for the community, or anything else worth linking here, please reach out to the community lead! These tokens cannot trivially be transferred from wallet to wallet, so they serve as a form of wallet-identification & credentialing. This particular implementation has some built-in tools for transferring credentials (which bans/deletes) the transferring wallet)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**VOTE DECISION**\\\\\\\\n-   NEP-393: Approved\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**ACTION ITEMS**\\\\\\\\n- Fill out \\\\u{201c}Changelog\\\\u{201d} section in the NEP with the reference to the video recording of WG call, benefit and concerns table - Robert Z\\\\\\\\n- Approve and merge the NEP - Vlad F\\\\\\\\n- Endorse SBT support in Wallets - Robert Z\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**RELATED RESOURCES**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- NEP-393 Soulbound Token on GitHub: [LINK](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/393)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n---------\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n  \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Events\\\\\\\\nWatch this space. NEAR Protocol\\\\u{2019}s contracts enable the possibilities of dApp development, and their standards ensure consistency in core primitives for those applications. If you are a dApp developer, you\\\\u{2019}re invested in contract standards! This group exists to connect those with interests in these standards to discuss and improve current standards, and maybe even propose new standards if such a need should arise.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## TIMELINE OF KEY EVENTS/HIGHLIGHTS \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n2023 Key Highlights \\\\\\\\n(Last updated June 14)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### COMMUNITY\\\\\\\\n- 167 members\\\\\\\\n- 2 community calls\\\\\\\\n- 4 Working Group calls\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### NEPS\\\\\\\\n- NEP-276 Payout NFT Standard Extension\\\\\\\\n- NEP-351 Add standards key to ContractSourceMetadata\\\\\\\\n- NEP-423 Add contract_metadata_update event\\\\\\\\n- NEP-463 Add nft_metadata_update event to NEP-171\\\\\\\\n- NEP-393 Adding soulbound token\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### EVENTS\\\\\\\\n- No events yet!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n---------\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## STRUCTURE\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nAs with many core DevHub groups, the Contract Standards group has two main parts:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Working Group\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis formal group is a selected committee of subject matter experts who make official decisions on proposals and questions related to the NEAR dApp standards. They follow a strict process to review proposals, recommend funding to DAO or grant programs, and hold grant takers accountable. They engage with the broader community to understand their needs and encourage ideation.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Members**\\\\\\\\n- [Alexander Fadeev](https://github.com/fadeevab)\\\\\\\\n- [Evgeny Kapun](https://github.com/abacabadabacaba)\\\\\\\\n- [Robert Zaremba](https://github.com/robert-zaremba)\\\\\\\\n- [Vlad Frolov](https://github.com/frol)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Community Group\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis informal self-organized group provides a space for anyone interested in changes to the NEAR dApp standards. This group is not controlled by anyone but the people who are organizing it. This group exists to connect those with interests in these standards to discuss and improve current standards, and maybe even propose new standards if such a need should arise.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## TIMELINE OF KEY EVENTS/HIGHLIGHTS \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n2023 Key Highlights \\\\\\\\n(Last updated June 14)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### COMMUNITY\\\\\\\\n- 167 members\\\\\\\\n- 2 community calls\\\\\\\\n- 4 Working Group calls\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### NEPS\\\\\\\\n- NEP-276 Payout NFT Standard Extension\\\\\\\\n- NEP-351 Add standards key to ContractSourceMetadata\\\\\\\\n- NEP-423 Add contract_metadata_update event\\\\\\\\n- NEP-463 Add nft_metadata_update event to NEP-171\\\\\\\\n- NEP-393 Adding soulbound token\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### EVENTS\\\\\\\\n- No events yet!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n---------\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## STRUCTURE\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nAs with many core DevHub groups, the Contract Standards group has two main parts:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Working Group\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis formal group is a selected committee of subject matter experts who make official decisions on proposals and questions related to the NEAR dApp standards. They follow a strict process to review proposals, recommend funding to DAO or grant programs, and hold grant takers accountable. They engage with the broader community to understand their needs and encourage ideation.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Members**\\\\\\\\n- [Alexander Fadeev](https://github.com/fadeevab)\\\\\\\\n- [Evgeny Kapun](https://github.com/abacabadabacaba)\\\\\\\\n- [Robert Zaremba](https://github.com/robert-zaremba)\\\\\\\\n- [Vlad Frolov](https://github.com/frol)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Community Group\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis informal self-organized group provides a space for anyone interested in changes to the NEAR dApp standards. While this group does not make official decisions, it offers a great opportunity to meet with others to share ideas and submit proposals. This group is not controlled by anyone but the people who are organizing it. {"handle": "nft", "community_addon": {"id": "7fjqz3", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Overview\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"A decentralized community of NFT builders in the NEAR Ecosystem. This group consists of the top NFT infrastructure projects, applications + marketplaces, smart contract developers service providers, founders, and PMs in the NEAR Ecosystem. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n# Builder Group\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nTheir is no formal NFT Working group, decisions around standards & funding affecting the NFT Builder Group are normally referred to the [Contracts Working Group](https://near.social/#/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.community.Overview?label=contract-standards).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nSome objectives of the Builder Group include\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- Ideate, Review, & Implement Protocol Standards (NEPs) relevant to NFTs\\\\\\\\n- Proliferate Open Source tooling to support NFT projects on NEAR\\\\\\\\n- Support  NFT tooling, marketplaces, applications, and infrastructure in the NEAR Ecosystem\\\\\\\\n- Exchange new ideas in the Web3 ecosystem\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n# Resources\\\\\\\\n- Original Governance Post [nearbuilders.com/nft-post](http://nearbuilders.com/nft-post)\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Wiki 1"}}
